content: Having a diagnoses of PTSD, doesn't need any interference by Politicians, needing to enhance their credentials. Serving in a combat zone doesn't and should not be an automatic qualifier for PTSD. This will just create a rush of more claims and chaos, in a system already overwhelmed by disengenuine claims. More than half the soldiers, entering a combat zone today are claiming to have PTSD. Do you find this realistic? I don't. This PTSD, thing is out of hand and worsens everyday because, those who are turned down become bitter, angry and revengeful troopers. If they're claim was genuine and met the necessary requirements, (simple documentation of Health records concerning dysfunctional behavior, etc.) would require a treatment plan be submitted, which, by the way is available regardless any decision. Veteran's are never turned down for health issues, (if they suffer ill effects of any kind) they're offered treatment, if so desired. Bills, aren't necessary, what are necessary, are those deserving suffering Veteran's who sacrificed and gave so much for their Country, be recognized expeditiously as possible and provided the treatment and benefits befitting a heroic effort on their part to protect our way of life. I agree only that a process be implemented, to relieve a system so clogged and overwhelmed with disengenuine claims. this can be accomplished simply by submitting a plan on the lines of, Hiring Qualified Doctors to, Cipher through claims and challenge any material not meeting the requirements of legitimacy. Also, add more Doctors, to quickly review any unresolved issues should legitimate Procedures be questioned. A time has come when the Treatment of those in need be addressed immediately. We must take care of our deserving Vet's without the hassles of unqualified. E-mail link removed MD This message has been edited. Last edited by: mainedawg, Tue 24 March 2009 07:51 AM

content: Greywolf, I was confused also, why you're confused concerning the issues surrounding PTSD. I'm fairly certain over the years you as well as myself have witnessed (through many years of group and other social participation) the behavior of those who just weren't genuine when interpreting their actual stress levels when describing events in Vietnam. This problem exist to this very day. Vote seeking Politicians, are agreeing with anything that passes itself off in a positive manner. Things such as: Bills that make PTSD automatic once a GI sets foot in a hostile Country. Making it unnecessary to prove a mental deficiency of any kind. This solution to assist Veterans seeking Care and claims is only adding to make this problematic condition even worse. Not everybody who served in a combat zone is entitled to benefits. Combat Veterans, who are deserving of aide usually find it relatively easy to accomplish this task. Documentation is provided upon request. Should verification requiring medical history be necessary, it is easily obtainable. What is becoming difficult are all the disengenuine Claims being submitted for PTSD. I can honestly attest to why many individuals over exaggerated their presents in a hostile area (never in a combat situation). I don't feel it necessary to explain. After many years attending group environments and other stress related settings, It's very obvious through the remarks of some participants that their presents could be viewed as something other then genuine. I hope you can see this as a crusade to better serve those with verifiable Disorders be given priority for treatment and other needs. These soldiers, deserve the respect and immediate attention necessary to settle any legitimate actions required and not be bog down in a process wasted on filtering claims that are not genuine. Surely, Graywolf, you can understand where I'm coming from. If not let me know and I'll explain another way. May not sound as nice, however, maybe it'll wake a few people up and see what's happening to our system. ***email address is removed*** all communications must be made through the profile page send option. content: I don't see where PTSD is granted automaticaly to anyone just because they stepped foot in a combat zone. Most vets don't even know they have PTSD. Example, I went to VA for a Neuro exam and was given comp for my knees and ankle. About 2 months after that I got a letter in the mail with Forms to fill out for PTSD. I filled them out and sent them in. I was given an exam a few months later and the Doc found me to be 50% PTSD. I did'nt even know about my problems being that bad, I ignored anyone who said I was different for 17 years. Now I understand a bit more on what others have had to deal with in regards to my mental health. For me it was not for the compensation, it was to find out and get help and an understanding of my illness.
